Experience of a Lifetime

Cruise the Great Barrier Reef with Australia's Most Awarded Tour

Your description

Experience nature's finest with Australia's best

For your experience of a lifetime, Quicksilver's wavepiercing catamaran and friendly crew will take you to a reef at the very edge of Australia's Continental Shelf, to an underwater world that is dazzling kaleidoscope of colour and brilliance.

Agincourt Reef - Discover the Outer Barrier Reef

Quicksilver takes you to Agincourt Reef, at the very outer edge of the Barrier Reef. Here, special reefs known as 'ribbons' run parallel to the Continental Shelf. Adjacent to the Coral Sea trench, these ribbon reefs are recognised as the most pristine eco-systems in the reef's environment.

Included in Your Day

Scenic Return Journey
Qualified lifeguard supervision
Marine Biologist Presentation
Reef Orientation
Fish Feeding (Conducted by crew)
Morning/Afternoon tea
Hot & Cold smorgasbord lunch
All Snorkelling equipment included
Underwater observatory fish & coral viewing
Stinger / Lycra suits & Buoyancy aids provided

Optional Extras

Towels & Swimwear
Hat, sunscreen & shirt
Cash for drinks at the bar
Credit card for shopping and optional tours
Underwater digital camera (hire available onboard in limited numbers)
Professional photo service available onboard

Included Activities

Included

Snorkelling

Snorkelling is one of the many activities included in your day and is one of the best ways to view the incredible underwater world of the Great Barrier Reef.

Included

Underwater Observatory

Even without entering the water, you can stay dry and explore the stunning reef from the comfort of a Quicksilver sub.

Included

Semi Submersible

Oceanwalker or 'helmet diving' is a unique and fun way to experience the underwater world of the reef up close and personal.

Snorkelling

Scenic Helicopter Flight

Optional

Ocean Walker

Oceanwalker or “helmet diving” is a unique and fun way to experience the underwater world of the reef up close and personal.

Pricing Information

Comfort and Space – Too much of a good thing is wonderful

Your journey is as important as your destination. It's a modern voyage, travelling in safety and air-conditioned comfort with state-of-the-art vessels that glide across the water to spacious platforms floating at the reef's edge.

Walk into the underwater observatory, or cruise just above the corals in a semi-submersible. Your questions answered, your needs anticipated, your care assured, you're free to enjoy the moment and savour the discoveries. From coaches, to cruises, to crew, it's a day that's all about you.

Activity PlatformVessel InformationActivities for non-swimmersInformation for Families

Your Day

9:15am

Check In

Check in at the Quicksilver reservations counter to receive your boarding pass.

9:30am

Boarding

After checking in, board the vessel and enjoy the complimentary morning tea/coffee on boarding. For your safety, hot drinks are not served once the vessel is underway. Pasengers are required to be onboard the vessel 15 minutes before departure (10am).

10:00am

Departure

Choose to sit in the air-conditioned cabins, or on the outside decks as our wavepiercer departs the Port Douglas Marina for the Outer Barrier Reef.

10:30am

Presentation

A marine biology presentation is shown on the vessel monitors 30 minutes after departure. A snorkelling demonstration will follow. If you're participating in scuba diving or helmet diving, you'll have a 30 mintue briefing with the dive crew in readiness for your dive.

11:30am

Outer Barrier Reef

Swim and snorkel from the activity platform. Underwater observatory open for coral and fish viewing. Semi-subs depart every 15 minutes from the rear of the platform. Pre-booked guided snorkel, scuba and helmet diving, and scenic helicopter flights commence as scheduled. Fish feed presentation is conducted in the snorkel area.

12:00pm - 1:30pm

Lunch Served

Lunch [included in the fare] is served. Enjoy a hot and cold tropical buffet, containing fresh prawns, pastas, meats, salads and fruit. There are full bar facilities available where you can purchase drinks.

3:00pm

Return

Depart Agincourt Reef for Port Douglas. Chat with the marine biologists, enjoy the reef video and even the photographer’s photos of the day on the homeward journey.

4:30pm

Arrival

Arrive at Port Douglas Marina

Getting There

From Cairns and Northern Beaches:
Our luxury air-conditioned coaches tour Cairns and Northern Beaches passengers along one of Australia’s most beautiful scenic coastal drives with a full commentary. A pick-up service is available from your accommodation. Times will be advised upon confirmation of booking.

From Port Douglas:
Coach Transfers are available from your accommodation. Specific hotel transfer times will be advised at confirmation of booking.

Making your own way:
Check in time is 9.15am at the Quicksilver office, at the Port Douglas Marina on Wharf Street, Port Douglas. Parking is available free of charge at the Marina.

Check-in opens at 7:15 AM
44 Wharf St, Port Douglas QLD 4877
